Event.name: Disaster_scenario
Event.definition: <def-root>This frame covers the large scenario for characterizing disasters, including the occurrence of particular types of disasters and the range of responses to disasters.</def-root>

Arg.name: Responder
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The individual or group that is responding to a disaster with directed action.
<ex>The <fex name="Responder">firefighters</fex> rushed toward the blaze.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Victim
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Victim</fen> (typically a large group) which is affected by the disaster event. </def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the place where the Undesirable_event occurs.</def-root>

Arg.name: Response
Arg.definition: <def-root>Directed action leading to recovery, rescue, or general mitigation of distress due to an ensuing disaster.</def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the time when the disaster scenario occurs.</def-root>

Arg.name: Duration
Arg.definition: <def-root>The length of time between the instantiation of the <fen>Disaster</fen> and the conclusion of the <fen>Response</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Disaster
Arg.definition: <def-root>An event of great proportional magnitude with evidence leaving blame to which only the stars might answer. A disaster is an indisputably ill-fated occurrence.</def-root>
